title: Israeli Summit of European Powers Collapses Amid Holocaust Dispute
summary: Israel's prime minister has tried to woo right-leaning European nations but has provoked ire with comments on the Holocaust. Israeli plans to hold a summit aimed at improving relations with Eastern European countries fell apart Monday after acrimonious exchanges over who was to blame for the murder of Jews during World War II.

title: U.S. Weighs Opening Liaison Office in North Korea
summary: The proposal, likely part of a package, comes as President Trump prepares to meet later this month with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.. The U.S. is considering opening a liaison office in North Korea, in what would be another potential step toward normalizing relations while the two sides negotiate to curtail Pyongyang's nuclear and missile forces, according to a Trump administration official.

title: Venezuelan Regime Plans Rival Concert to Coincide With Branson's
summary: Maduro government says it will also hand out food to poor people in neighboring Colombia, as humanitarian aid for Venezuela piles up at the border. The government of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, who faces growing pressure to step down and a public-relations problem on the border with Colombia, plans to organize a rival musical performance this week in response to a Live Aid-style concert staged by billionaire Richard Branson.

title: An Arizona Occupational Welcome
summary: Recognizing out-of-state licences would help newcomers get to work.. Arizona last year attracted more than 122,000 newcomers, many fleeing states with crushing regulation and taxes. Republicans are now giving overtaxed Californians and New Yorkers another reason to move to the state by making it easier to work and start businesses.

title: Italy's 5 Star Activists Vote to Protect Government Ally
summary: Court had recommended that Interior Minister Matteo Salvini face trial for refusing to allow migrants to disembark from ship. ROME-The members of Italy's 5 Star Movement voted on Monday against letting the party's far-right ally Matteo Salvini stand trial for the alleged kidnap of more than a hundred migrants last summer.

title: Navient Rejects $3.2 Billion Takeover Bid
summary: The student-loan servicer says $12.50-a-share proposal is too low. Navient Corp. has received a buyout offer worth about $3.2 billion from a pair of investors that the student-loan servicer rejected as too low.

title: Senior Aide to Canada's Trudeau Resigns Amid Political Storm
summary: Departure of Gerald Butts, Canadian leader's confidant, intensifies fallout from SNC-Lavalin case. OTTAWA-A senior aide and close friend of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau unexpectedly resigned Monday, as the fallout from a political storm focused on allegations of judicial interference continued to reverberate in the Canadian capital.

title: Two Netanyahu Opponents Discuss Joining Forces
summary: Benny Gantz, a retired Israeli army chief, and Yair Lapid, a former TV anchor turned parliamentarian, are in talks to form a united front. TEL AVIV-Two of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's most formidable opponents are in talks to form a united front, and face a deadline this week to declare whether they will join their political camps to try to unseat him.

title: U.S. Ally Against Islamic State Urges Trump to Leave Troops in Syria
summary: Top Kurdish commander wants up to 1,500 forces to help safeguard Kurdish forces from Turkey and keep Islamic State militants from regaining power. AN AIRBASE IN NORTHEAST SYRIA-The Kurdish commander leading the fight against Islamic State in Syria urged the U.S. to reconsider its decision to withdraw all its forces and instead leave a small contingent in the country.

title: Bank for Japanese Farmers That Fuels the Global Lending Market
summary: Ninety-five-year-old bank's massive holdings of collateralized loan obligations ties deposits of Japan's agricultural businesses to health of American companies. Corporate borrowers were in a tough spot for a few weeks in January. Things had been looking up after the December market swoon, but there were problems in a part of the market that serves junk-rated companies.

title: Martina Navratilova's Girl Power
summary: The tennis legend says allowing transgender women in women's sports is 'cheating.'. Are athletes who are born male but identify as female cheating girls? Tennis legend Martina Navratilova says they are.

title: Europe's Challenge Is Decline, Not Trump
summary: Even George Soros warns that the EU may 'go the way of the Soviet Union in 1991.'. The greatest mistake Europeans can make is to believe that their biggest problem is Donald Trump.

title: We Overcame a Grim Prenatal Prognosis
summary: Doctors said our baby couldn't survive birth. We tried something new, and it worked.. Radical legislation in New York and Virginia has brought late-term abortion into the spotlight. Advocates justify the practice on the ground that, as one put it, "terminations after 24 weeks are for severe fetal anomalies."

title: 'Long Shot' Review: Triggering a Revolution
summary: A memoir by an Iranian deserter turned Kurdish sniper who picked off 250 Islamic State ﬁghters during the battle of Kobani.. For the past seven years, in the northeast wedge of Syria abutting Turkey, Iraq and Islamic State, a band of zealous Kurds have built an unrecognized state called Rojava and tried to keep it from being overrun. Rojava is governed like a 1980s Berkeley dorm discussion whose participants have acquired automatic weapons. They are anarcho-leftist, environmentally conscious, secular, socialist and radically devoted to equality of the sexes. One manifestation of this last commitment is a coed guerrilla force, including male and female snipers (féministes fatales, if you will) who have been picking off the male jihadists of Islamic State with gusto for the past five years.

title: Ocasio-Cortez Heralds a New Political Era
summary: Socialism may not become America's dominant ideology, but it's likely to be around for a while.. Washington

title: Amazon, New York and the End of Corporate Welfare
summary: Special tax breaks do little to spur the economy. Now they're becoming politically unpopular too. Are New Yorkers better off after Amazon's decision Thursday to cancel its planned headquarters in the Queens neighborhood of Long Island City? It's a complicated question, weighing the benefits of new high-earning residents against the added strain on local services. Yet the pullout could lead to a decisive triumph for taxpayers across the nation, as city and state officials start to reckon with the popular backlash against corporate tax incentives.

title: Trump Doubles Down on Failed Counterterror Policy
summary: The U.S. and allies need to deal with local grievances, which give Salafi-jihadi groups their opening.. President Trump's counterterrorism strategy has amounted to doubling down on past failure. He has promised a full withdrawal of troops from Syria and a partial withdrawal from Afghanistan, the better to focus on directly attacking terror cells. That narrow definition of counterterrorism misses the real threat: the Salafi-jihadi movement, which continues to gain strength across the globe.

title: The Search for Reliable Chinese Jobs Data Intensifies
summary: Measuring China's jobless rate has always been a headache. There is unreliable Chinese economic data, and then there are China's unemployment figures.

title: Roses Are Red, Orchids Are Addictive
summary: Resume Subscription. About a year ago, 11-year-old David Marcovici started collecting orchids. Since then, he's amassed a few dozen that have turned the family kitchen into a mini-rainforest. His favorites are miniatures, which he calls his "little guys."

title: OPEC Officials Say U.S. Sanctions Against Its Chief Won't Derail Plans
summary: The oil cartel will operate as usual while Venezuelan Manuel Quevedo is penalized by the U.S., OPEC officials said. OPEC will continue to operate normally despite U.S. sanctions placed on the oil cartel's Venezuelan president, officials from the group said on Monday.

title: Apple's Executive Shake-Up Prepares for Life After iPhone
summary: The moves reflect an effort to diversify the company's revenue streams and reduce its reliance on iPhone sales. Apple Inc. is shaking up leadership and reordering priorities across its services, artificial intelligence, hardware and retail divisions as it works to reduce the company's reliance on iPhone sales.

title: Global Stocks Edge Higher as U.S.-China Trade Talks Progress
summary: U.S. markets will remain closed on Monday for Presidents Day. Global stocks edged higher Monday as renewed hopes for a trade deal between the U.S. and China helped boost sentiment.

title: There Are Dangers in Being Your Own Doctor
summary: If you are going to doctor yourself, first do no hurt.. Regarding Andy Kessler's "It's Time to Fire Your Doctor" (Inside View, Feb. 11): As a self-employed person for over 30 years, I have not found myself facing the conundrums that Mr. Kessler assumes are common. My Blue Cross Blue Shield Individual Plan was $73 a month 30 years ago and now is $249. My doctors don't charge $500 to take my blood pressure or $1,200 for a blood test. For the part of my blood work that Blue Cross didn't cover for my last physical, my total charge was $44. Most doctors have agreements worked out with Blue Cross and other health insurers whereby charges are reduced so that the subscriber's out-of-pocket expense is considerably lower than the official fee.

title: A Rebuttal to Cardinal Dolan on New York's New Abortion Law
summary: The law allows abortion up to 24 weeks with exceptions for later abortion in the case of a threat to the life or health of the mother and in the case of inevitable fetal death.. Regarding Cardinal Timothy Dolan's "Abortion's Dred Scott Moment" (Houses of Worship, Feb. 8): New York's Reproductive Health Act, which includes the law pertaining to abortion, is described as "grisly legislation that permits abortion in many cases up to the moment of birth." This is a woefully incorrect characterization of the law, which allows abortion up to 24 weeks (near the end of the second trimester, not "the moment of birth") with exceptions for later abortion in the case of a threat to the life or health of the mother (a provision already in place through Roe v. Wade) and in the case of inevitable fetal death.

title: A State Government-Caused Winter Chills Upstate New York Economy
summary: Under Gov. Andrew Cuomo and in large part under his father, as well, upstate New York has become a place of economic darkness.. Regarding your editorial "Cuomo's Cold Weather Tax" (Feb. 6): Under Gov. Andrew Cuomo and in large part under his father as well, upstate New York has become a place of economic darkness. There is no calculating the extent of economic harm this team did to New York state's economic vitality. Almost every one of the state's upstate counties has lost population.

title: The GOP Calls for a Shrewd Senate Vote on the Democrats' Utopian Green New Deal
summary: Sen. Ed Markey is irked about Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell's masterstroke vote-call maneuver.. Regarding your editorial "Vote on the Green New Deal" (Feb. 12): That Sen. Ed Markey, co-sponsor of the resolution behind Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's Goliath-government "Green New Deal," is irked about Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell's masterstroke vote-call maneuver tells you that even this Massachusetts uber liberal knows that showcasing this state-saturated scheme has drawn an unwanted spotlight on just how radical the Democratic Party has become.

title: Killing Carbon-Free Nuclear Power
summary: This is ideology trumping true concern over carbon-dioxide mitigation.. California's assault on PG&E goes even further ("When Politicians Direct Capital," Review & Outlook, Feb. 1). Witness the coming premature retirement of the Diablo Canyon nuclear plant with 2,200 megawatts of carbon-free, base-load electricity generation. This is ideology trumping true concern over carbon-dioxide mitigation.

title: Key Investors Are Unhappy With SoftBank Fund
summary: High valuations of Vision Fund investments-and the decision-making role of SoftBank chief Masayoshi Son-have led to concerns. The two biggest outside investors in the $100 billion Vision Fund are complaining about the high prices the fund's manager, SoftBank Group Corp. , has paid for tech companies and the control wielded by SoftBank Chief Executive Masayoshi Son over investment decisions.

title: The Link Between Menopause and Alzheimer's
summary: With Alzheimer's afflicting more women than men, researchers are studying whether the hormonal changes that occur in menopause may affect the development of the disease. Women make up nearly two-thirds of patients with Alzheimer's disease in the U.S., in part because they live longer than men. Now, researchers are exploring whether hormonal changes related to menopause affect the development of the disease.

title: Baseball's Shifting Financial Equation: Long-Term Security Over Free Agency
summary: With the free-agent market in a deep freeze for the second straight winter, more players are choosing to sign long-term extensions to lock in a guaranteed payday. Proof that baseball's financial equation has fundamentally changed isn't in the number of free agents still available, or Bryce Harper and Manny Machado's continuing unemployment. The most telling sign is in the behavior of the young talent that isn't yet on the market.

title: A Labour Revolt Against Corbyn
summary: Seven MPs bolt over anti-Semitism and Brexit abdication.. A British political party splintered on Monday, and for once it wasn't the ruling Conservatives. Seven members of the Labour opposition resigned from the party in protest over leader Jeremy Corbyn's inconstant dealing on Brexit and tolerance for anti-Semitism.

title: The FBI's Trump Panic
summary: McCabe reveals how officials contemplated a bureaucratic coup.. The American people have largely taken the disruptive Trump Presidency in stride, going about their lives and expressing their approval or not the constitutional way-at the ballot box. The same can't be said for many of the country's panicked elites, as we are learning anew about the Federal Bureau of Investigation as former deputy director Andrew McCabe hawks a new memoir.

title: Munich Conference Highlights a Divided U.S.
summary: Vice President Pence and Democrats offered competing visions of trans-Atlantic relationship. MUNICH-A divided America was on display this weekend in Munich where Vice President Mike Pence and Democrats including his predecessor Joe Biden offered competing visions of the trans-Atlantic relationship that could shape the world for years to come.

title: Why Your Apps Can Find You, But 911 Can't
Spouses Switch Roles for a 2020 House Race
summary: Ann Ferlic Ashford seeks seat that her husband, Brad Ashford, once held, on the heels of an election cycle that saw a record number of female candidates and Democratic women win. WASHINGTON-Former Rep. Brad Ashford had his shot. This year, it is his wife's turn to run.

title: Worrying About Deficits Falls Out of Style
summary: The widening federal budget deficit has yet to result in economic calamity, but as more money goes to interest payments on debt, less is available for things like infrastructure, schools and social benefits. It's no longer cool to talk about the federal budget deficit.

title: Brexit Rift Deepens as U.K. Labour Lawmakers Quit Party
summary: The schism within the Labour Party echoes divisions also plaguing the ruling Conservative Party over the U.K.'s departure from the EU. LONDON-Seven lawmakers quit the U.K.'s main opposition Labour Party on Monday, the biggest defection from a major British political party in nearly 40 years and the latest evidence that Brexit is accelerating a realignment of the country's politics.

title: How Amazon Will Grow Without a New York HQ2
summary: The e-commerce giant still expects to bulk up its staff in New York City and boost hiring throughout the U.S. and Canada. Amazon.com Inc.'s decision to abandon its $2.5 billion plan for a New York City headquarters could disrupt redevelopment and dash hopes for a surge in hiring in the neighborhood of Long Island City. One entity unlikely to suffer much: Amazon itself.

title: 'Spreading Like a Poison': Anti-Semitic Incidents on the Rise in France
summary: Spate of incidents, including the harassment of a prominent public intellectual, raise fears that yellow-vest protest movement is stirring up hatred. PARIS-A spate of anti-Semitic incidents has accompanied France's yellow-vest protests in recent weeks, raising fears that the movement is stirring up hatred in the nation that is home to Europe's largest Jewish population.

title: FAA Probes Southwest Airlines Over Baggage Weight Discrepancies
summary: Government's yearlong safety investigation uncovers problems with weight and balance calculations across Southwest's fleet. Federal air-safety regulators are investigating Southwest Airlines Co. for widespread miscalculation of the total weight of checked bags loaded onto each of its flights, according to government officials and internal agency documents.

title: In a Volatile World, Europe Struggles to Find Its Voice
summary: Foreign-policy stumbles show EU's difficulty in responding to pressure from China, Russia and the U.S.. MUNICH-Alarmed by the erosion of the post-Cold War order, Europeans are grasping at ways to influence a world in which Russia, China and the U.S. under President Trump are all jockeying for position.

title: Discounts on SUVs Are Getting Bigger as Dealer Inventories Rise
summary: In contrast, sedan discounts declined last year as supplies shrank to match waning demand. Auto makers are pulling back on discounts on sedans and shifting more promotional dollars to sport-utility vehicles and trucks.

title: At Top Colleges, Graduation Gaps Persist for Poor Students
summary: As elite schools expand access for low-income students, graduation rates lag. Elite colleges nationwide have increased the number of low-income students they enroll in recent years, but getting those students to graduate has been more challenging.

title: Negative Yields Mount Along With Europe's Problems
summary: The proliferation of negative-yielding government bonds underscores the uncertainty over the growth prospects in much of the developed world.

title: Oil Prices Extend Climb on Falling Supply
summary: Brent bolstered by fresh evidence OPEC is making good on its promise to cut crude production. HIGHLIGHTS

title: Bad News Is Good News for Stocks Again
summary: Stocks are up around the world, even as economic data has disappointed and earnings forecasts have been cut. The mantra that gained popularity in the years after the financial crisis-bad news is good news-is back. That should remind investors that finding themselves on the wrong side of major central banks can be perilous.

title: Australia Says Foreign Government Behind Cyberattack on Parliament
summary: No evidence that hackers intended to interfere in coming elections, prime minister says. CANBERRA, Australia-A cyberattack on Australia's parliament was carried out by foreign agents, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said, coinciding with a warning from the country's top intelligence official that spying against the key U.S. ally has reached unprecedented levels.

title: Europe's Pharmacies, Long Protected, Face Shake-Up
summary: Belgian entrepreneur is winning over customers, and authorities, by challenging traditional outlets for personal-care products. BRUSSELS-A drug war is raging in the heart of Europe-over pharmacies.

title: Amazon Leaves New York but Not the Spotlight
summary: Retreat unlikely to hurt business, but the tech giant remains a target of both ends of the political spectrum. Amazon.com Inc.'s sudden move to abandon plans for a new campus in New York ends the protests in the city but doesn't remove the national scrutiny being placed on the company, according to corporate reputation and management experts.

title: U.K. Lawmakers Rebuke Facebook in Call for Social-Media Regulation
summary: Report recommends laws governing privacy, data protection, antitrust and competition. LONDON-A U.K. parliamentary committee rebuked Facebook Inc. in a report that calls for regulation and intensified scrutiny of social-media companies.
